Description: A Brown (Bruen) study, study for a satirical print in the series 'Political Sketches', published by Thomas McLean, 1821-1851; O'Connell sitting in gloomy contemplation of the news of Colonel Bruen's election for Carlow. 1840 Graphite Verso: The new Pasha of Egypt; Palmerston as a turbaned Pasha on an Arab horse, under a palm tree, attended by Lord Ponsonby. 1840 Graphite
Curator's comments: Study for Political Sketch No 666. Verso: Study for Political Sketch No 663.
Bibliographic references: Binyon 1898-1907 / Catalogue of drawings by British artists, and artists of foreign origin working in Great Britain (150)
Associated names: Portrait of: Henry Temple, 3rd Viscount Palmerston
Associated with: Louis Nicolas Philippe Auguste, Comte de Forbin
